title: Elanor Commercial Property Fund buys 200 Adelaide Street ahead of IPO
text:
ASX-listed Elanor Investors Group has scooped up the prominent Brisbane building 200 Adelaide Street for its Elanor Commercial Property Fund ahead of the fund's planned $255 million public listing.

A second acquisition will join the fund before its listing with Elanor agreeing to buy up the remaining 49 per cent of the Perth A-grade WorkZone commercial property in the Perth CBD.

The fund already owns 51 per cent of the asset, bought for $125.25 million last year, following a counter-cyclical strategy in the recovering Perth market. Both assets were acquired from Charter Hall.

Including the two new acquisitions, the fund would list with six assets across Western Australia, Queensland and South Australia independently valued at $306 million. More acquisitions are being slated over time but they will not be limited to these states.

Moelis is heading up the listing while Ord Minnett and Shaw and Partners are joint brokers.
description: The fund will also buy the remaining 49 per cent of the Perth A-grade WorkZone commercial property in the Perth CBD.
